alert.note: Alert for La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 3:38AM MST until January 11 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 7500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 7500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...La Sal and Abajo Mountains. * WHEN...Snow will taper off in many areas by late morning then pick up in coverage and intensity this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
